resources.string: 30 Days of Wisdom
Day
Start with Yourself
The world changes with your actions
"Be the change that you wish to see in the world" — Mahatma Gandhi
On Meaning of Life
The meaning of life is to live meaningfully
"Life has only the meaning we give it" — Jean-Paul Sartre
Goals and Dreams
Aim high — even failure brings success
"Shoot for the moon Even if you miss, you'll land among the stars" — Cecelia Ahern
On Time
Time waits for no one, use it wisely
"Time is free, but it's priceless You can't own it, but you can use it You can't keep it, but you can spend it Once you've lost it, you can never get it back" — Harvey MacKay
Overcoming
Strength is not about never falling
"Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall" — Confucius
On Happiness
Happiness is not in possession, but in appreciation
"Happiness is not a destination, it's a way of traveling" — Margaret Lee Runbeck
Choosing a Path
Follow your own road, even if it\'s hard
"Find what you love and let it kill you" — Charles Bukowski
On Action
Dreams without actions remain dreams
"The only way to do great work is to love what you do" — Steve Jobs
On Wisdom
Knowing much is not key, knowing what matters is
"I know only that I know nothing, yet others do not know even this" — Socrates
On Goodness
Do good, even if no one is watching
"Do not be overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good" — Apostle Paul
On Courage
Fear will pass, regret will remain
"Courage is not the absence of fear, but rather the assessment that something else is more important than fear" — Meg Cabot
On Simplicity
Happiness is often hidden in simple things
"Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated" — Confucius
On Future
Don\'t wait for the future — create it yourself
"The best way to predict the future is to invent it" — Alan Kay
On Patience
Everything great takes time
"Everything comes to him who waits" — Leo Tolstoy
On Thoughts
Your thoughts shape your reality
"We are what we repeatedly do Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit" — Aristotle
On Journeys
Even the longest journey begins with a single step
"A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step" — Lao Tzu
On Work
Love what you do
"Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life" — Confucius
On Forgiveness
Letting go of grudges sets us free
"Forgiveness is giving up the hope that the past could have been any different" — Lily Tomlin
On Knowledge
Knowledge not applied is dead
"Knowing is not enough; we must apply Willing is not enough; we must do" — Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
On Self-Belief
No one can believe in you more than yourself
"Believe in yourself! Have faith in your abilities! Without a humble but reasonable confidence in your own powers you cannot be successful or happy" — Norman Vincent Peale
On Reading
Reading good books is conversing with the wise
"Reading good books is like having a conversation with the finest minds of past centuries" — René Descartes
On Greatness
Greatness begins small
"The tallest tree grows from a tiny seed" — Paulo Coelho
On Lies
Lies destroy trust faster than anything
"A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes" — Winston Churchill
On Nature
Nature holds the greatest wisdom
"Nature abhors a vacuum: where people don't know the truth, they fill the gaps with guesswork" — George Bernard Shaw
On Essence
Look at the root, don\'t settle for the surface
"Everything flows, everything changes, and you cannot step into the same river twice" — Heraclitus of Ephesus
On Risk
Nothing ventured, nothing gained
"You cannot move forward without risk The biggest risk is not taking any risk In a world that is changing quickly, the only strategy that is guaranteed to fail is not taking risks" — Mark Zuckerberg
On Love
Love is the only force that can change the world
"Love is the only rational activity of man" — Leo Tolstoy
On Solitude
Great thoughts are born in silence
"Solitude is as necessary to the mind as fasting is to the body, and just as fatal if it lasts too long" — Luc de Clapiers, Marquis de Vauvenargues
On Change
Action conquers fear of change
"Fear disappears when you start doing what you're afraid of doing, instead of thinking about it Be interested in what's happening inside you as much as what's around you" — Eckhart Tolle
Summary
Your main project is yourself
"The one who walks the road, masters it" — Lucius Annaeus Seneca
